name: Super Cyborg
description: Super Cyborg is an old school non-stop hardcore run'n'gun action game! You are an elite battle cyborg who is sent in to investigate a series of anomalies on a mysterious island. The merciless alien known as the 'Xirxul life form' has been awakened by unwitting scientists and now: all humanity is in danger!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP, Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8 Processor: Pentium 4 800MHz or equivalent Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: ATI or NVidia card w/ 256 MB RAM DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 100 MB available space Sound Card: Yes Additional Notes: NetPlay requires a very good internet connection for better experience. Slow connection and high ping may cause glitches.
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows XP, Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8 Processor: Core 2 Duo 2GHz or equivalent Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: ATI or NVidia card w/ 512 MB RAM DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 100 MB available space Sound Card: Yes

reviews.review_text: Aw man, This game really brings back all my nostalgic feels when I was playing Contra on NES The soundtrack, the 8-bit graphics, the character movement, and the gameplay and above all else, even the menu screen is so nostalgic. Most importantly the game can be played multiplayer both locally or through the net. Thank you Artur Games.  Definitely a recommended game for the old school gamer.

This is hands down the best NES probotector/contra clone I've seen. I have played the crap out of Probotector I & II back in the day on the NES as a kid and surprised to see how well it resembles those games. I like the color palette and boss battles are much better designed than in the original. Worth a look if you are into retro games and a must have for contra fans. Great 8-bit nostalgia trip!

A clone of classic Contra games but a bit harder.  The way of how the cyborgs move, how they jump, run, shoot and even die, all of the animation presents the same like in the old time, so does the feedback when you press a button to make any move.  Since it is a clone, the graphic is definitely old-school styled. With better hardware support nowadays, it displays more colors and details. The music is well composed in classic ways.  Also, a little surprise for players when finishing the game.  If you like classic Contra on NES and SNES, this game is a must-have for you. A gaming controller is really recommended.

Very well done Contra clone. YOu couldnt really ask for much better in terms of gameplay or graphics and still get such a great clone. Highly recommended to any and all old school gamers like me who played Contra as a kid and want more!  10/10 Would Komani Code again.....
10/10, nostalgic NES-shooter goodness, just as I remembered it.

If you enjoy wondering why you're still playing a video game, you've found the right place to be. After your 12th try trying to kill the ♥♥♥♥ing boss, you begin to wonder why you're still doing it. But you keep doing it because you can't let this ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ game beat you. And before you know it, it's 4 AM. You can't let victory slip into the hands of Flyman, no matter how long it may take you.  10/10 would recommend

Well, it's a lot like Contra. A bit too much, I think; it's the same one hit-per-life gameplay where the best strategy is just deleting enemies as soon as they run onto the screen, and getting hit leaves you with the default machine gun, and usually in a bad way as a result. If you really liked Contra it's probably quite fun but if you didn't it doesn't seem to have any modern changes.

It's a contra clone, but very cheaply done. I love the oringal NES contra, great design, great challenges and smooth and very well excuted.   This on the other hand has some bad issues that keeps throwing me out of the contra nastalgia. First is the framerate...at time it's really smooth, but mostly it's just not. It goes from what appears to be low fps, that's hard on the eyes, to sometimes a bit choppy, all sorts of really bad stuff done, in a game with low end graphics. Just feels like as powerful as my computer is, this shouldn't happen. I also tried changing all sorts of settings, they didn't do anything, except make the game look and feel even worse.  Shooting...well, my biggest gripe on this, is when you go up and down diagonal platforms...while trying to shoot up/down them. At times your bullets all go into the ground, other times, he shoots directly over everyone's head. Very frustrating. It's like the bullets have a set path, and the ground just doesn't match...which just makes me wish they never put diagonal type pathing.  Design...well, I liked the original's diversity. In here, they kind of did mostly right scrolling. The one that was kind of top down, well, it felt like they forgot about it so rushed it into one place. Even the platforming felt forgotten. IMO, it just felt like they didn't particularily care about the design.  Of course, all that said, it's not like they're asking a lot of money for this game...however, all this game made me really want to do was load up an emulator and play the classic again.
Nice game, but way too easy :-(

Insert Konami Code Here (Up/Up/Down/Down/Left/Right/Left/Right/B/A and Start). :)  I found this game after listening to a Super Contra remix of Stage 1's music and a long-play video of Super Cyborg was listed on the right of the page. So, I decided to buy it and give it a shotl. This game absolutely rocks. One nice feature in particular is the Automatic Save feature that saves your progress after each stage.   If you've played Contra, Super Contra, Contra 3, Hard Corps, etc... you should feel right at home with Super Cyborg. The gameplay mechanics are very close to the same with a few new features packed in such as the Alternate Fire Mode for each weapon.  Now, I wish I had an NES (or even a Super NES) controller with a USB adapter to play the game with. But, that's ok.
It's basically a contra clone, and a good one at that. Challenging, engaging, fun weapons, supports multiplayer, and is basically an old school style contra. Highly recommend!

Do you like Contra? Do you like Run 'N Gun games like Contra, Metal Slug, Turrican, Gunstar Heroes and Journey to Silious?   BUY. THIS. GAME.  The controls are perfect. The graphics are wonderfully retro. It's Contra-hard. And it works with just about any controller, you do not have to futz around with a 360 controller emulator or Xpadder. And it's an f'n steal at $4.99.   BUY THIS NOW.
Do you like Contra and Super Contra on NES? This sure feels like it. It even has it's own extra lives code.
i have no idea if it's a good game or not, just opened it up. It's basically Contra and it will bring back memories so it's worth the money just because of that.
Throw your controller hard, they way these kind of games SHOULD be. Great simple controls, no extra crap you dont need. 10/10

I wish this developer had more games out. SUPER CYBORG is well crafted and lots of fun. It feels incredibly like Contra, I'd like to see what else Artur can do with the genre. I bought this game for casual play and I'm sure I will be playing it on and off for a long time to come. In my day this game would have cost 30 dollars used, so 5 bucks brand new is a steal. For best results you should play with a controller (I did, and I feel great.) This game is instantly downloaded to even the most feeble and incompetent gaming rig and there really is no excuse not to do it now if you haven't already.
